title: Garum
summary: Garum is a fermented fish sauce which was used as a condiment[1] in the cuisines of Phoenicia,[2] ancient Greece, Rome,[3] Carthage and later Byzantium. Liquamen is a similar preparation, and at times they were synonymous.  Although garum enjoyed its greatest popularity in the Western Mediterranean and the Roman world, it was earlier used by the Greeks.[4][5]
